references.paper_title: LORA: Low-rank adaptation of large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the LoRA method, a crucial technique used in the GameFactory framework for efficient fine-tuning of pre-trained models, enabling adaptation to specific game datasets without significant computational cost.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a fundamental model for bridging the gap between image/video and text data, enabling text-based prompts to control video generation in GameFactory.
This foundational work lays the theoretical groundwork for diffusion models, a core component of GameFactory, which are used to generate realistic video game sequences.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical underpinnings for score-based generative models, which are leveraged in GameFactory to enhance the quality and realism of generated video game content.

This paper presents a transformer-based latent video diffusion model, which serves as the backbone architecture for video generation in GameFactory, providing efficient and high-quality video synthesis.
